column2: KENTUCKY PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Kentucky

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 2. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 3. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column6: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.

column2: 4. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: One-way street ahead

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 7. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass trucks

column2: 9. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Run away.

column2: 10. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a sharp turn.

column2: 11. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 12. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian Crossing

column2: 14. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: the direction they should travel.

column2: 15. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column6: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column8: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

column2: 16. A curb painted red means:
column4: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
column8: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off

column2: 17. The road is the most slippery:
column4: after it rains.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 18. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 20. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: flash your brake lights.
column6: let them pass if it's safe to do so.
column8: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.

column2: 21. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
column8: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.

column2: 22. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 23. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 24. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 25. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a brake failure.
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 26. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 27. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: drive with your window down.
column6: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
column8: scan the road ahead for hazards.

column2: 28. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.

column2: 29. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column8: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 30. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: The other driver.

column2: 31. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
column8: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

column2: 32. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column6: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column8: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.

column2: 33. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 34. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
column4: Pass with caution

column2: 35. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 36. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: Marijuana.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends

column2: 38. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Construction and maintenance warning.
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 39. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 40. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep your eyes moving.
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
